Computer Parts

RAM and Storage

RAM:

RAM is short term memory for programs and files currently open. It isn't nearly as slow as the hard drive, so it is used to quickly launch a program. The memory from the Ram is lost after you turn off your computer. They are usually small but very fast.

Storage:

There are several types of storage like hard drive and solid state drive. A solid state drive is faster, but much more expensive. A hard disk drive is slower, and less expensive. You can also use external hard drives, or thumb drives. Some more types of storage are SD cards and Micro SD cards, CDs, DVDs, and floppy discs.

fun fact 1
Dell was founded on February 1, 1984, and was started in Austin, Texas, United States.

fun fact 2
Razer was founded on 1998, and was started in San Diego, California, United States.

fun fact 3
Corsair was founded in 1994 and started in Fremont, California, United States, and the founders are Andy Paul, John Beekley, and Don Lieberman.
